thread.title: City & United in talks over Manchester derby to be held in the USA
thread.title_full: City & United in talks over Manchester derby to be held in the USA

title: City & United in talks over Manchester derby to be held in the USA
text:
City & United in talks over Manchester derby to be held in the USA Getty 0 Feb 22, 2017 23:15:14 The two clubs were due to meet in China last year but for a waterlogged and badly damaged pitch, and are now planning a fresh meeting in the States 
Manchester City and Manchester United are in talks over a high-profile pre-season friendly in the United States this summer, Goal has learned. 
Mkhi underlines importance to Man Utd 
The Premier League heavyweights were due to contest the first overseas Manchester derby in Beijing last summer, only for bad weather to render the pitch at the Bird's Nest Stadium unplayable. 
But there is a likelihood that the two sides will meet in the International Champions Cup ahead of the 2017-18 campaign, with senior officials ironing out the details in recent weeks. 
An agreement is yet to be reached but it is understood there is a willingness on both sides to find time in their respective schedules. 
City are set to visit the American Midwest this summer, while United travel the west coast. 
Last summer, either side of the planned derby in Beijing, United played Borussia Dortmund in Shanghai while City took on the Bundesliga side in Shenzhen. 
And this time around it is believed the Manchester rivals will visit different cities when not in competition with each other. Related
